ygData.subject: Re: Now about 1hs vs. 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow level 15 gruk, congrats, it wasn t that long ago you were level 1 :)
ygData.messageBody:
Wow level 15 gruk, congrats, it wasn't that long ago you were level 1 :)

> ----------
> From: Sean.Clark@...[SMTP:Sean.Clark@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 4:41 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Now about 1hs vs 2hs Re: Rangers and
> warriors
>
> From: Sean.Clark@...
>
> Grukk tinks its never too late to gets your weapons skills up!
> Dump 5 or 10 points into traing if yous can afford dat. Then use dat
> weapon
> yous are trying to work on when yous fighting blues and whites in a group.
> Grukk tink yous be surprised how fast yer skills go up. Me maxed 1 handed
> slash and 2 handed slash right now...and archery is pretty close. As
> soon
> as me dually wield gets maxed me gonna stick so piercing weapons and blunt
> weapons in me secondary hand when fightin easier stuff. If'n yer more
> intelligent than Grukk yous may find yer learnin even easier then Grukk
> does!
> Grukklukk of Bristlebane, lvl 15 Troll Basher
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 1:20 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Now about 1hs vs 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
>
>
> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>
> You make some good points. I will admit that when I started I was focused
> on dual wield...I realized my mistake at 12th level but by that time it
> was
> to late to work on my 2 handed slashing skill. My ranger alternates
> between
> a fine steel 2 handed sword and a mino axe/shiny brass shield combo. I am
> keeping both skills maxxed at every level.
>
> My opinion on the 1hs vs 2hs is this. Warriors need both. For blue mobs
> the only way to fly is 2 handed with double attack at higher levels. You
> hit very often for high damage, and with double attack you are a
> devastating
> hack'n'slash machine. For higher level mobs that con yellow or red, the 1
> handed weapons shine because of their speed. You are not going to hit
> high
> level mobs as much, so having 50% more swings gives you a better chance to
> do damage, even if you do less damage...some is better than none.
>
> I am interested to hear others opinions on this. And what do you think of
> trying to get my 2hs skill of 14 up to 80 on my 15th level DE warrior?
> Worth working on? Or will I have a hard time increasing skill?
>
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Date: Monday, May 24, 1999 1:59 PM
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>
>
> >From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> >
> >--- Jason Coan <COANJ@...> wrote:
> >
> >> Paladin.....they ARE a joke, their healing ability
> >> is a joke, their buffing ability is a joke, because
> >> their heals and buffs are 9 levels behind, the only
> >> thing they have going for them is their lay hands,
> >> which can be very good, but I dont' think it makes
> >> up for their lack of melee ability.
> >
> >Uh ... ok. If you say so. I call Paladins 'self-filling tanks',
> >because they are just that. They're not really effective until they
> >get Meditate at 12th, but once there they can do a solo fight that
> >drags them down to 1 bar of HP; and be back in another fight in 7-10
> >mins. For a corresponding warrior, it would be 13-18 mins, or more.
> >
> >Lay On Hands is the Panic Button; you can push it to get out of jail,
> >or at least, have more time to either finish off the mob or run for
> >safety.
> >
> >As for the spells being 9 levels behind, so? Paladins are
> >fighter/healers, while Clerics are healer/fighters. Clerics can be
> >mini-tanks up until about 9th or 10th; but Paladins can tank all the
> >way to 50. The ability to tank and still have a reserve to compliment
> >the party's cleric is useful. Past 10th, Clerics are 80%+ casters for
> >all realistic intents and purposes.
> >
> >Paladins don't get Kick; but at 6th they get bash which I personally
> >like much better. Kick won't interrupt casting, while Bash will. I
> >stopped using Kick with my Troll Warrior when I got Bash (which let my
> >Slam start being much more effective)
> >
> >If you're fixated on Dual Wield (which I think you might be, since you
> >mentioned Rangers; and they're the only hybrid, that I recall, that
> >gets Dual Wield); that might explain why you like Warriors and Rangers
> >the most.
> >
> >Personally, I think the jury's still out on Dual Wield, and on melee in
> >general. The further up you go, the more the offensive and debuff
> >spellcasters really carry the fight to the mobs; the tanks are just
> >there to do what their name says. If this is proven out, then Dueal
> >Wield or no, the tanks are just there to soak damage. If this is not
> >proven, then Dual Wield still has to debate against the endless fighter
> >arguements of Dual Wield vs 2H Weapons (which is one of those semantic
> >arguements, IMO; stats bear each out)
> >
> >For grouping, I'd prefer to have pure tank in the tank slot, any day of
> >the week; with a Paladin fighting alongside him. (my ideal 6man group
> >is 2 Warriors, 1 Paladin, 1 Cleric, 1 Wizard, 1 Bard; haven't assembled
> >it yet, but it sounds fun!) For soloing, however, the Paladin is more
> >efficient than the Warrior.
> >
> >===
> >:D
> > Dave's World
> >-No matter where you go, there you are-
> >"People will believe a lie either because they want to
> >believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
> >First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
